replies.body: What about adding an option to avoid a particular role, if you pick Fill as your primary?
Logged in just to upvote.Rito please.I pick fill because I don't care what role I play,not because I'm a sup main.

The root of this problem that support is the least popular role so anyone who expresses willingness to play support in the current system is always placed as support. Giving people an option to avoid a particular role when filling will only make that problem worse.  

The solution I prefer is giving people smallish-bonuses to ip-rewards weighted on the inverse of the popularity of their role in dynamic queue.  It would make people more willing to play support, and being a support main myself, it would make me happy.

It actually makes the problem worse. People know that support is the least played role and that choosing either the Fill option or Support as a secondary role will lead to you playing support 90-95% of the time. I would be content playing support 30-50% of the time and leaving it as my secondary role, but whenever I put support as my secondary, I get it almost every time. Because of this I generally avoid ever putting support or fill as an option. 

They need to make priorities based on which role you choose. Support secondary mains are either getting phased out or changing into support mains.

What they need to do is add a bonus for having played your secondary role.  If you played your secondary role for several games, well now let's prioritize it so that you are chosen first for your primary role in the next game.

Currently the Mid/Supp people are encouraged to not put supp in because it's the only way they'll get mid.  Under the system I proposed people are encouraged to put supp as an option because it means they will get to play mid in a future game.

The current system decreases the pool and makes the problem worse, my system would increase the pool and reduce the problem.

The solution won't be IP rewards or related.. The solution is making SUPPORT a role worth playing. It's boring, you're at the bottom of the barrel, can't carry as easily as you can in other roles, the list goes on and on. Riot giving bonus IP to players who play support is like saying "Hey, this role is garbage but we need to keep queue times down, so here's IP". It's just sad.
thats definitely your opinion... not everyone thinks the role sucks. i enjoy playing support.

“Alice: Would you tell me, please, which way I ought to go from here?
The Cheshire Cat: That depends a good deal on where you want to get to.
Alice: I don't much care where.
The Cheshire Cat: Then it doesn't much matter which way you go."
Fill is a role selection for those that don't care what they get, as such not wanting to play support is a preference that you can avoid simple by selecting a role other than fill.

My problem with this is the same as I've always had. I _like_ support - I just don't want to play it 90% of the time. I want to be able to list top/support (my top two preferred positions atm) and get top at least more than half the time. I don't know how to make that happen, but at the moment, we have this horrible situation where you always get support when you queue support because everyone knows that and thus doesn't queue support unless they actively want to play support (in turn meaning the few people who have support or fill queued almost always get it, meaning that they don't queue fill and support as much, etc., until no one but support mains are queuing support).

This option is good for the players, but it will significantly increase the queue time for everyone. Imagine 90% of players picking "Fill" but opting out support role. It will take forever to find supports for all of the teams.

I'm a fill main, so I'm a support main.  You do have a pretty good point, so I suggest instead of a hard "not whatever position" a system that gives preference away from a certain role, rather than eliminate the possibility entirely.  If you say "not top lane" then you are unlikely to be top anyway because others will want to play that lane.  Currently 80-90% of my games are support, and I wish there was an option to limit that to 40-50% and just throw me in a random other role.

So you are saying they should add "Random" option to the mix so players who do not want certain roles but do not have an idea what to play can choose this option? The "Random" option will use RNG instead of leftover roles as the basis of matchmaking for these players.

It's actually a nice idea, even though the impact on matchmaking is unknown until Riot experiment with this option.
That's not filling, then. :3

I know :P but I'm aware I'm not the only one that doesn't like playing a particular position. 
For example, give me any role other than adc; it's not that I don't have ranged physical carries, I'm just bad with them.
This. I'd rather queue for anything except Top lane.

Everyone: Hey, it's kind of hard to counter Zed now that his main item counter doesn't affect him anymore.

Riot: What's that? You want more ults to be unaffected by QSS? NO PROBLEM!
yet ww's still is. {{item:3070}} {{champion:19}}
And with every patch, {{item:3140}} becomes more and more useless

So you don't reach Mastery 6 just by playing well, you have to hope you randomly get that champ or blue shards from crafting as well? So you have to pay or get lucky. This feels out of sync with the design goal of mastery.

Changes dragon buff to ensure nothing can modify true damage results.

Changes towers so they modify true damage results.
As discordant as it is, I approve of both changes. I'm also ok with towers playing by slightly different rules than champions.

> Fixed a false error message that occurred when entering a game lobby

This is more music to my ears than DJ Sona. Thank you.

Reminder that Treeline and ARAM still don't have Champ Mastery. RGM modes were somehow deemed higher-priority than League's permanent game modes. Players can demonstrate skill and dedication in temporary modes like URF or Ascension, but can't do so in ranked TT.

Yeah some people only play ARAM just as some people only played Dominion (or as Riot now calls it "Definitely not Dominion") and there are a lot of inconsistencies dealing with how Riot prioritizes their announcements and changes.

Ban rate has nothing to do with how strong a champion is. It has to do with a champion's _perceived_ power. Zed isn't brokenly op now, people just think that he is. However, he is still very powerful, but I don't think giant nerfs are justified.

Um, did you not get the memo? The literal only counter to Zed's braindead 100-0 no-counterplay-whatsoever combo got removed in the last patch. You let him through and the other team picks him, enjoy your 4v5 because your ADC doesn't get to play the game. That's why his banrate is so high.

1. His ultimate has a 0.75 second delay. That means your team can plan ahead to hard cc him as soon as he lands.
2. He is one of the squishiest champions in the game. Hit him a couple of times, gg 5v4
3. He is 100% skillshot reliant, save for one auto-attack. You can technically dodge all of his abilities (just a fun fact, not actually like a legit amount of counterplay)
4. Tanks will shut him down, as he has a lot of trouble against him.
5. He needs to get ahead or at least break fairly even. As a melee champion in a lane filled with ranged champions, you can abuse his W's long cooldown to harass him all day. As long as your other lanes aren't stupid and ward up, which, admittedly, is rare in solo Q, he can't snowball off of them.
6. He falls off a bit late game, being unable to deal with the AD's lifeteal and unable to lay a finger on the tanky frontline.
7. He has some of the slowest burst out of all assassins unless he's really far ahead.
8. {{item:3157}} 
9. He's only a safe pick into certain team compositions. Most front liners and supports with half a brain (again, rare in solo Q) will save their hard crowd control for when he jumps in.
10. He's built to destroy bad players. If you misposition, he will kill you. Otherwise, why have assassins at all?
11. Zed excels in mid-game skirmishes and duels. That's what he does, and he does it well. Saying "Nerf Zed, he's too good at assassinating people" is like saying "Nerf Leona. There's no counterplay to her brainless stunlock initiation pattern."
12. There are other assassins out there who are just as cancerous. To name some: Talon, whose burst is around as high, has stealth, has a 99% targeted slow, and has much faster burst. LeBlanc, whose burst is even higher, comes out faster, has one skillshot, is even more mobile, and has hard crowd control in her kit. Fizz. Just, Fizz.
13. {{item:3053}} 

Do your research before just blatantly calling a champion OP. He is powerful, yes. He is frustrating, yes. He can delete squishies, yes. But he does not have "braindead 100-0 no-counterplay-whatsoever" burst unless you and your team are dumb enough to let him get super ahead.

this, seems well thought out but it really doesn't say much, basically all you're saying is, dodge skill shots, don't fight zed and don't feed zed, pretty freaking generic advice

while I don't think zed is op, he doesn't have much counter play now, and most of your team suggestions don't really apply to solo Q/DQ,so throwing your team at him before he instagibs you isn't a viable suggestion, also the item suggestion don't even apply to a majority of the champs that zed just jumps on and deletes with zero repercussions for the most part. 

maybe his ban rate is high only in bronze to gold, but that's where a majority of people are, so stuff like he doesn't get banned in diamond is irrelevant because 80% of the player base is in bronze - gold

most of your suggestions seem to ignore the fact if a zed player is good he will land his skill shots, so all your saying is "beat him don't let him beat you"


zeds, problem for me anyways is he's just too safe and a safe assassin doesn't make sense they are high risk high reward, not low risk high reward, even if zed is behind you cant zone him from farming, he just sit back push waves and wait for ganks, even after he ults you if things go south for him, he just leaves lol, zed isn't punished for being outplayed, hes only punished if screws up his combo, that's the problem right there.

"For this update, we’re focusing on hitting Sol’s in-fight reliability." You already did that before he was even released by not allowing his Q to double tap for melee champions.  "Celestial Expansion’s amazing flexibility, forcing opponents to march to his beat." So you're increasing the cd on it cause its already not easy to avoid it entirely and get through? I mean just about everything can send his stars back to their original position which then puts them on cd "Putting some of the counterplay back" Really? When he was initially released he was already super easy to counter play, by any champion that was melee or that had a dash.

Which is basically every champion except for a few. Maybe that's why he has near a 1% playrate? Meanwhile, Lucian and Zed aren't being changed. Sometimes Riot is just spot on. Times like these, I just have no idea what they're thinking.
